intro: Rauvolfia parvifolia var. cubana, commonly known as Cuban wild lettuce, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Cuba. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and traditional medicinal contexts.
